messages: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:56): wonders how an operating system and browser implemented in pure ecmascript would work
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:57): Since there is no way to access the hardware or anything
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (12:58): I just replied
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:16): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: even taking that assumption as a given, the further conclusions don't make sense, so I decided not to argue with it
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:17): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: but it does seem so hypothetical that it's not a very strong argument against API convenience
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:18): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: I noticed you had mentioned XMLSerializer in the logs
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:19): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: in reference to our old discussion, yeah
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:19): it was incidental to the topic (which was Selectors API enhancements)

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:19): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: considering possible new information since we last discussed it, what's your take on changing WebKit to serialize HTML DOMs as XML if the MySpace problem were evangelized away?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:20): I think the fact that WebKit serializes HTML DOMs as HTML was totally an accident
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:20): and I'm surprised and alarmed that sites ever came to depend on it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:20): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: do you consider it a fixable accident?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:21): if MySpace is the only significant breakage, and if it can be fixed, then yes I think it is fixable
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:21): our intent was to emulate the Gecko API

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:22): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: given what 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c said, can you speculate on whether Opera would align with the Gecko trunk behavior?

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:23): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Is the failure to emulate Gecko when it comes to non-void but empty http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml elements on the XML side deliberate, though?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:23): I.e. WebKit does <div></div> rather than <div/>
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:24): when serializing XML elements in the HTML namespace, we attempt to produce HTML-compatible XML, in all our paths for producing XML
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:24): if that created compatibility issues in specific contexts, we could change it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:24): Yeah, I thought that was deliberate.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:25): well, we didn't make a conscious choice to apply it to XMLSerializer specifically
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:25): so would the agreeable convergence target be taking the WebKit XML-side behavior and making it standard on both HTML and XML trees?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:25): we decided to do that based on other contexts that serialize to XML (possibly even native APIs) and decided to do it everywhere
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:25): (so the delta to Gecko trunk would be turning <div/> into <div></div>)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:26): I think that would make sense, if MySpace can be fixed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:26): any views from anyone from Opera?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:26): also for void elements we put the gratuitous space before the slash
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:26): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I'm fine with aligning
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:27): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, will you write a spec? :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:27): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: which alignment? :-)
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:27): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, with the spec :p
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:28): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I don't think we care much either way, as long as sites work, so Gecko trunk + MySpace fix would work

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:28): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: I commit to writing a spec on the spot here without approval from Mozilla, but I've worked under the assumption that morally I'm on the hook for writing a spec some day
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:28): I *can't* commit
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:29): one negation makes such a difference in sentences :-(
